number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 18, 2014
												This game is addicting for those who want to git gud. After almost 300 hours of play I still get a rush out of near-death experiences and finding rare loot. I still enjoy it even despite playing solo because my friends think I'm insane for playing such an unforgiving game. Sure, I'm prone to quitting for long periods of time after losing one or more maxed-out characters over the span of a day or two, but I always seem to come back eventually. Maybe I have a problem.Anyway, about all the complaints about Kabam and their business model, I feel that most of them are more or less unsubstantiated. I've been playing since the game belonged to its original developer and, while it does feel different now than it did back then, its core is still very much intact. The only things you can buy with real money that aren't available in-game are cosmetic (and even amongst those items there are plenty you CAN get with gameplay alone). You can still grind for anything else money can buy. It's still plenty skill-based, with plenty of learning and achieving to do. The only thing Kabam has really done to harm the game has been the introduction of overpowered pets, but even those can be acquired through gameplay. I'll admit, however, that it does put newer players at a noticeable disadvantage, but it at least sets a new overarching goal for players beyond maxing out a character, since the pets keep through death. I actually think the removal of amulets helped level the playing field a bit too, since they were super expensive and the only players who could really afford to stock up on them could already max out a character anyway.All in all, the game is still just as fun as it was years ago, before it came under new management. It seems that instead of reviewing it objectively, old players can't help but look at it through their rose-tinted nostalgia goggles.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 3, 2014
												Okay, so some people hate this game, some love it, so here are my thoughts. The unique gameplay and artstyle/character design is what truly holds this game together, otherwise the advertising spamming, insane micro-transactions, and on-and-off lag would ruin it all. So as you've probably figured out, this is a top down shooter, which as far as I know is pretty unique for a fantasy MMO. This game is quite challenging, it is a permadeath type game so if you die you must pick a new character and start completely over, on the other hand it isn't terribly challenging as long as you play it smart, there is also a hotkey command to bring you back to the safezone. The Perma-death can really turn you off, especially if you have good items and was close to reaching level 20, reaching level 20 will unlock a new character class or two, which is pretty much what keeps you playing. This game also has a massive amount of enemies for you to fight, many with different abilties, which is also what makes this game unique. I'd recommend everyone at least try this game, you may hate it, you may like it, and let me just say I don't play this excessively, its just something fun to play here and there. also its a very tiny download and takes a few seconds, its worth a try.

Posted: July 28, 2016
												This game has changed me quite a bit over the few years that i have been playing this game. This game has taken over my life for the past few years. Its a very addictive however this game does have a big learning curve, Expect to die... a lot... You can't get very far in this game without spending any money at all. You will need to spend money at some point due to the limits you have with 1 vault and more importantly 1 character slot. If you haven't played this game, go try it out. Its free! You will start this game not knowing anything (unless you've watched a lot of videos) and you will die a lot even if you do watch videos. Expect raging and jealousy if you play this for a while. Thats all i have to say. Overall amazing game. Keep realming!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 18, 2012
												***I have decided to get back into Realm once again (through the web/client version) and it is a very exciting game. So I have decided to come back from my extremely old review (with no reason to recommend) and have completely reworked and rewritten the review.***With constant imaginative enemies fighting you ranging from cute but deadly bunnies to Oryx the Mad God himself. This game is a bullet hell - and god damn is it a crazy bullet hell. Missiles flying in every direction imaginable, enemies releasing missiles in every direction adds the challenge to RotMG as you really have to learn how to use the controls effectively before being able to imagine the higher levels. But those higher levels are extremely rewarding if you reach so it is absolutely worth the time doing dungeons.There is a natural annoyance with the business model, it has very expensive "packages", being sold  which can be bought with the in game payed currency "gold" or just money, with just the "beginner package" being sold for $20 for a new account and $60 after. However, none of the packages in RotMG actually need to be bought, you can achieve the same as anyone else without paying - it is harder, yes, but it isn't like it's quicker if you pay, it's just easier if you do.Overall I would recommend this game from the point of view that it is F2P so you're not wasting anything by buying it.

												Here are the pros and cons of this game.Pros: It's free.Has items to purchase, but not really a pay to win.Despite only have one music theme, it's pretty good.Challenging, but not too hard. You go up to almost any wandering player and ask to team up and they'll say 'sure'. Very few players here even talk. LAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAG.I rate the steam version 7/11

												Realm of the Mad God (RotMG) is a side scrolling shooter that is amazing for being a browser game. It plays like an arcade game adapted for more accurate play with a mouse. It keeps up the challenge with the risk of dying to enemies and having to start over, encouraging players to fight alongside eachother and even includes a teleport option to any player in the region. The game as multiple classes to keep interest in the game.

												It was ok. The fact that there is perma death is cool, but... It kinda sucks when you have 200 things on the screen at once. Also, no pause button. If you stop moving, you almost quite litterally die. I heard this game used to be good before all of the REAL money transactions became available. I'm kind of so-so about this game. I didn't play it for that long... But, almost nothing makes since. What do I do? Where do I go? Who am I? Thats what this game tried to do. It doesn't perfect it though. I always see some message come up about the "Mad God" but before I read it, you can pretty much imagine what happens. I don't know what level you should be for some areas (Difficulty Wise). Also, I have no idea about anything or anyone because of no explanation. Half of the tutorial is just you moving around. The other half is just killing some enemies that you can one shot. If this game had better storyline, explanations, and community, I would recommend it. But I don't. Because it kinda sucked

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 19, 2015
												The gameplay is overall good, but the bloody microtransactions are rediculess. They hinder and annoy you, inconvienencing you. You cannot make additional characters unless you want to fork over 10 dollars, if you want additional storage in your vault(and you are going to need a way to store your items if you want to get anywhere in the game) that would be 5 dollars a chests, which holds 8 items each. It would takes over a hundred dollars to even unlock all of your storage space. Even the big fans of the game do not buy additional storage, but instead go make additional characters on the game's website and on Kongragate to use as additional storage and are known as "mules." Even when using mules it is annoying.The gameplay is good, a semi-rogue like where your characters die and stay dead but you can store items to help your next character. The Nexus, the central hub of the game, is constantly filled with advertisers that will fill up your screen instantly. The gameplay is frustrating at times, especially because you can die very quickly with little to no warning, but is fun. The higher level you get, the more cautious you have to be. The game encourages team play, but it would take actual coordination to get anywhere with it.Overall, game is good, but is absolutely ruined by the amount of microtransactions.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 11, 2015
												So, basically this game used to be the gods gift of online MMORPG's. BUT WildShadow Studios (creaters of RotMG) became total sellouts and practically gave the game away to a company called Kabam. Now, heres where stuff gets interesting. There used to be something called an Ammy (Amulet of Resurrection) which you equipped in your ring slot to give you both +2 on every stat and also a 2nd life. When you die, your amulet breaks and you respawn. This acted almost like life insurance but in ROTMG. Kabam turned this item into what is now known as a scammy. They are UT (which i will get to later) and instead of respawning you, they turn you into a zombie which can kill your fellow players. Secondly, what Kabam did wrong was make UT's untrable which ruined the whole purpose of excitement when getting a White Bag or Cyan Bag drop. Some items such as the CSerpent Staff are now mainly feed items as is the EP staff and Bulwark wand. Third of all, they brought in items which you could buy with Realm Gold, this makes ROTMG a P2W game. Don't mind my hours on Steam, i primarily play on the browser client which if hours were counted I would have 600+ easily. The nexus now sells WC tops and also Old tops for Realm Gold which can be purchased with real money! So noobs can pay $20, get heaps of gold and buy full tops set such as- T11/12 Weapon, T5/6 Ability, T12/13 Armor and Para/Exa rings for under $50. This is outrageous. I will still play the game however, as I am a fan on working hard to get what you want. Overall I give this game a 5/10 with Kabam ownership and 10/10 with WildShadow ownership. Thanks for reading my review and upvote it if you agree!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 19, 2014
												This game is pretty "okay".It runs on flash which means that it never runs lag-free. (Part of it is, it being a bullethell-MMO)Even though the developers try to keep the game up to date, it rarely feels like they are really adding *new* and *exiciting* stuff.Most of the content that was added recently, had already existed before Kabam was in control. It is pretty frustrating that the only *new* equipment, they add are either complete crap or a reskin of an already existing item.About 3 months ago, I stopped playing this game since I already have achieved most of the stuff I can achieve and new content is either really boring or not important because it doesn't drop important stuff.Also RNG is a pretty HUGE factor here which doesn't make the game as fun, when your friends have 300 hours less and just get an item you have been searching for 300 hours.I am still *recommending* this game because it is pretty fun as long as you have new content which you always have when just starting the game. After achieving everything, the game is not really fun to play.The perma-death aspect of the game is interesting but can be REALLY frustrating due dying because of lag isn't that rare. (No refund btw)GL HF anyway guys.

content:
Posted: June 8, 2015
												a fairly addictive 2d bullet hell game.be prepared to grind a lot, but the grinding is far from boring. dungeons are randomly generated, and can also have treasure rooms to multiply your loot gain.by far my favorite part of the game is the loot system. the more damage you do to the boss, the more loot you get. it inscentivises and rewards actively tackling the boss instead of leeching, though some more difficult bosses drop treasure chests that contain the loot.the game currently still has a lot of problems, left by the old developers.kabam's logic "instead of fixing duping, let's just make a lot of the rarest items in the game untradable.""we'll ban some people for hacking if they're reported, but not have moderators to actively survey the situation.""let's make some of the BEST ITEMS IN THE GAME AVAILABLE FOR PURCHASE IN THE STARTING AREA FOR TEN DOLLARS SO THAT NEW PLAYERS CAN SEE HOW GREAT WE ARE"all in all, 10/10 praise deca

content:
Posted: June 7, 2016
												Here are the pros and cons of this game.Pros: It's free.Has items to purchase, but not really a pay to win.Despite only have one music theme, it's pretty good.Challenging, but not too hard. (At least for the most part)Nice pixel top down shooter overall.Cons: Despite the music being good, it can be a bit reppetitive.Not many updates. (Been a while since there's been a new dungeon added.)The community on steam. Everyone on the website version of ROTMG is more lively and communicate more. You go up to almost any wandering player and ask to team up and they'll say 'sure'. Very few players here even talk. LAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAG.I rate the steam version 7/11

												This game has changed me quite a bit over the few years that i have been playing this game. This game has taken over my life for the past few years. Its a very addictive however this game does have a big learning curve, Expect to die... a lot... You can't get very far in this game without spending any money at all. You will need to spend money at some point due to the limits you have with 1 vault and more importantly 1 character slot. If you haven't played this game, go try it out. Its free! You will start this game not knowing anything (unless you've watched a lot of videos) and you will die a lot even if you do watch videos. Expect raging and jealousy if you play this for a while. Thats all i have to say. Overall amazing game. Keep realming!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 4, 2016
												Realm of the Mad God is a great Free to Play title, and the community sometimes can be very helpful in terms of experiences and your overall enjoyment of the game. But the community is also highly critical of the game. It isnt as active as it used to be years ago, but this is mostly due to lack of content being added to the game. Hopefully in the future the game may be sold to somebody who can keep up with the community, but is still a great fast paced perma-death game. You should be able to get hours of enjoyment out of it till you start to get higher up in the ranks where things seem more and more repetitive. The community overall though is very passionate about keeping the game alive and letting it blossom. Sometimes talks of its pay to win aspects discourage new players, but you can definantly survive in the current meta without dropping any money in the game.

content:
Posted: July 28, 2016
												So, first of all, I would like to acknowledge the quality of gameplay this outstanding game has brought upon me. Because of this game, it has made me want to kill myself on a daily basis, has given me the thought of joining the KKK and has made me want to vote for Donald Trump. The feelings this game has given me has opened my eyes about how cruel this world is and how better off I am becoming a stripper. Games like this have given me such unforgettable memories that I will unfortunately cherish forever. Moments that I still remember after starting this game one year ago. Where I died as an archer to a Scorpion King with its very OP family of bratty scorpion children, and the first time I've gotten a white bag, in which I lost right away after some monsters came in from the other room of an Undead Lair dungeon. After all of these overwhelming events, I reccomend this game to any toxic kids from XBox Live so they can feel just how we feel when they tell us to drink bleach. 10/10 Game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 28, 2016
												This isn't really a review of the game as a whole, but rather of its state right now. This game used to be in a very bad place. Realm was neglected by its owner Kabam, which allowed hackers and exploiters to do whatever the hell they wanted with the game. Realm was very slowly dying, and many well known players within the community were leaving, and overall the whole experience of playing this game became a lot less fun. Luckily for us, Kabam has recently sold our beloved game to people who actually give a♥♥♥♥♥♥about it; Deca Games. In the past month or so Deca Games has done so much to improve the game and restore it back to its former glory. Right now is the best time you've ever had to start playing Realm. I recommend anyone to give this game a chance again if you already have in the past, and if you're new you should 100% give it a try.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 7, 2016
												Here are the pros and cons of this game.Pros: It's free.Has items to purchase, but not really a pay to win.Despite only have one music theme, it's pretty good.Challenging, but not too hard. (At least for the most part)Nice pixel top down shooter overall.Cons: Despite the music being good, it can be a bit reppetitive.Not many updates. (Been a while since there's been a new dungeon added.)The community on steam. Everyone on the website version of ROTMG is more lively and communicate more. You go up to almost any wandering player and ask to team up and they'll say 'sure'. Very few players here even talk. LAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAG.I rate the steam version 7/11

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 14, 2016
												Simplistic Roguelike with suprisingly large open worlds where it's easy to find yourself in challening areas. The loot in this game is very situational, with most drops containing items from other classes, which are utterly useless unless you have friends or a group with you, but with the large amount of drops, it's easy to just ignore the useless ones. The game is also flooded by spambots advertising a WoW "pay for gold" system, which is also easy to ignore. For the simplicity and quirkyness, it's worth the money to buy this game ($0 is quite a bargain) but it's great to pick up and play for a few minutes in your spare time.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 5, 2015
												Okay. Realm of the Mad God...What do I say about this? well...I quite enjoy it. It's a fun addition to the Non-♥♥♥♥♥♥ selection of F2P games...If you are looking at review and haven't played the game...why haven't you played it yet? There is loads of fun to be had (Even more with friends though...we will get to that later). It's a permadeath game where you have to select a class and battle enemys around the nicely sized world (Some get really powerful and hard to kill so watch out for that) Including but not limited to, Pirates, Snakes, J-Jelly Cubes???, Balls that shoot more balls and there are even more. Now...There are also bosses aswell and this is where the game will take you down at your first couple times. Every once and a while a quest will appear with and arrow pointing to the area on your screen...This is where the bosses are. Bosses range from easy to HOLY ♥♥♥♥ THIS IS HARD quite quickly if you don't grind for levels. but this is where the lock and teleport features come in -Ahem- Okay it's time to introduce (Enter black and white television mode) Teleportation and Locking! If at any point you lock a player they will stay at the bottom right of the screen for you unless they leave the world or enter a portal (Find them out for yourself) and you can lock your friends to keep with them. You can also teleport to locked or unlocked people that are close to you. If you are ever in a tight spot or need to catch up to your friends you can teleport to locked or unlocked people like I said before! (Oh yea and there is a trading system but find that out from yourself) -Leave black and white television mode- The game does get slightly tedious at points it is still a soild experience you should definately give a go.Final Score--------------9.5/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 3, 2014
												I have played this game for many many... MANY hours and here is why you should get this game and try it out for yourself. And from the guy who has been in this game since Wild Shadow was owning this game (Which is in the Late Wild Shadow Era) you SHOULD take my review as a good one. Thx and luv ya.The Pros:1) It is just plan fun in anyway. You would basically never get bored of this game. It has in store many FUN quests and places to fight bosses.2) The people here are helpful, fun, and most of all, important and needed. This is an MMO game. If there was not many people helping you in this game, you would have a REALLY tough time playing this game. This community is HUGE (Not as huge as Team Fortress 2 Sadly...)3) Perma death. Now some people would HATE losing there powerful chars. in the game. However, for me I think it is a wonderful idea. For someone who plays PLENTIFUL amounts of Fire Emblem. This teaches you to be more careful with your character as your journey continues and when you die, it is a lesson on next time avoiding that problem (unless it is lag then I can not help you out there)4) Always getting some sort of update to it in the game. This game has fun updates to it. From adding pets to it to adding new weapons to just redoing or reskining the old ones. This game gets updates like crazy. And there is always something new to the table.The Cons:1) To get stronger in some cases... requires money. Ok so I do not do this per say. But in order to become stronger for some people you NEED money in this game to get the full experience. They do not have to even try playing the game. Just spend a few bucks and BAM (get it?) you get maxed out character with the most powerful weapons. I perfer some people to not do that unless they really need it.2) Stronger and long time members of this game could steal your loot. When you fight boss quests or dungeons. People who do the most dmg. get the loot. And if you are just starting off small and working your way up. You are probably gonna have a long time before you can actually get to were the stronger people are.3) Pets. No offense. I LUV pets with all my heart. But it just makes the game easier in every way. Sometimes when I make a character i would probably never use the pet at all since it brings more difficulty to the game. It makes some classes useless in some cases like Priest and his healing ability because the pet could heal A LOT for you.Note: If I missed anything please tell me. I will add it with your name as credit. Thx.Conclusion:In conclusion, I love this game with all my heart. Even though I kind of stopped playing it when I started playing TF2. I do perfer you try it out for yourself to have the kind of experience I had when I had played that game. Who knows I might come back to it someday. COME ON! SMILE FOR ME! :)

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 3, 2013
												Fun if you play with friends, but boring if you're by yourself. Positive things about it include the fact that it takes a couple of minutes to learn how to play, it's not faceroll easy as there is a constant struggle to survive, it's free, there's a lot of different classes to choose from, it has a unique system for maxing out a character's attributes, and it's a very small installation.Negative things to say about this is that there's no actual currency and trading is always really annoying because of all the autotypers everywhere, there is an excessive amount of microtransactions obviously due to the game being free, there is no variety in the realms (they're all the same♥♥♥♥♥♥but with different names), and it's just overly repetative. The realms should all be different terrains with different mobs... and  it'd be nice to have something to look forward to achieving other than fame-whoring for high scores or collecting potions to max out attributes.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 6, 2016
												Edit: I don't have 4.3 hours on this game. I have 4.3 hours on steam, but around 360 hours on the game on the web browser.This game is mostly great! It's a truely great Perma-Death MMO experience. From the monsters to the bosses, everything seems to line up and make some sort of pixely genius of a game! There are some cons of course. First of all it's pay to win to the max. You can buy max level gear and dominate throughout the game. Another problem is that it contains urgles... The laggiest thing I have ever seen in a game to date. It shoots out these orbs that make more orbs. This causes you to often die because of how much it drops your frames. Another thing is that it's Perma-Death, so if you have problems with losing all of your gear when you die, I don't recommend this game. If you add up all of the pros and cons, I think that this game deserves a good review!

												Overall, I thought this game was very good. The thing that really stood out to me though was that this game is just a lot of fun to play. Sure, there are much better free to play games such as "Planetside 2", but Planetside 2 doesn't quite have the 'charm' that Realm of the Mad God has. Pros: I really liked the perma death part of the game some may disagree and find it annoying, but I think it is good so that that game has a good challenge to it. The game is very fluid and doesn't lag; I play on usually 4-5 bars of internet and have a fairly good PC (6 GB RAM and an I7 2.4 GHZ processor for those who care). I have never encountered any bugs personally although my friend got instanly killed randomly somehow in Oryx's castle.  Cons: This game is very pay to win oriented I have found. Generally in order to get anything good or get any money to buy things you have to pay. The money pays for unlocking different classes and buying good items. That brings me to my next point; the item/looting system in the game is not very good (unless you pay) because I tended to get the same items over and over again as well as getting very underpowered items. The devs need to add in a wider variety of items into the game that can be found in the item sacks dropped by enemies. Also, I feel that this game was meant to play with friends . . . the problem with that is there are really not many functions to play with your friends. Yes, you can make a guild, but you have to have played for a very long time to create one. It would greatly increase the multiplayer party potential if they made it so that any level/money/fame character can create a guild. Overall, this game is very fun to play as it may not have the graphics of other free games like Planetside 2, but that is by far made up in the overally fun I've had playing this game. Yes, I would recommend this game. Overal though, don't expect yourself putting in over 50 hours because the game wears out after awhile though, but the game is free, takes only around 30 seconds to download hence only takes up around 250 mb of space (give or take a little I don't remember the exact amount) so what do you have to lose? I would highly recommend at least trying this game . . . if you don't like it, it isn't hard to uninstall. I would rate this game a 7/10.

content:
Posted: May 6, 2016
 Great F2P Game  Great Bullet-Hell MMO , which is F2P. It offers alot of classes, items , realms , dungeons , monsters and gods. It got prema death , which  made me better player overall. When u die there is no way to retrieve your character. U lose all your items and gear u had on this character. If u find good stuff u can save it in the Vault and later use it with other character. Great leveling system and ranking system. The leveling system is simple: U kill an enemy and u get XP , u got 20 levels , when u reach Level 20 , u dont get anymore XP and instead u get FAME . The fame is for the ranked system. With every class ,when u earn FAME , u complete your class quest. Every completed class quest gives u Star. When u get alot of stars , for example : 28 u get  Red Star  Which is your rank. Thats how the level and ranked system work. Alot of people say the game is P2W. Well the answer is  NO . Yes u can buy all the items from the start with real money , but if u play alot and try harder , u can take these items  from the dungeons and stuff. So the game is  NOT P2W .  There is a few bad things in the game  There is  ALOT OF BOTS AND HACKERS  , and the developers dont do anything about it.  The servers sometimes stops or lags alot Theres alot of spammers on the Nexus ( Spawn ) Overall i recommend this game , or atlest try it. Its good F2P and alot of fun.  EDIT: The game is now acquired by DECA GAMES. They promise to fix all the hackers , bots and server issues. I hope they finally fix the game and continiue expanding it !

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 12, 2016
												Realm of the Mad God is a massively multiplayer online shooter video game created by Wild Shadow Studios (acquired by Kabam in June 2012, and later sold to Deca Games in July 2016) and Spry Fox. It was in public beta from January 2010 and the browser version launched on June 20, 2011.[2] On February 20, 2012 the game was made available on the digital distribution platform Steam for Microsoft Windows and OS X.[3]The game has been described as a "massively-multiplayer cooperative bullet hell shooter" with an 8 bit pixelated art style.[2] Players control characters who have been transported to the realm of Oryx (the titular Mad God) to become food for his many minions and abominations, which the players must dispatch. Central to the design of the game is the fact that character death is permanent. Upon death, the player's character is lost along with all carried equipment, although the player may store a number of items for safekeeping in a limited capacity vault away from danger. Different character choices in class also help make the game more diverse and help to support teamwork.The game is free-to-play with optional in-game micro-transactions. Items which can be bought with optional transactions include in-game equipment vary from high-level equipment, pets that provide aid to the player (by attacking enemies, paralyzing enemies, healing the character, restoring the character's magic points, and acting as a decoy) increased storage space, and aesthetic features such as skins, cloths and dyes.[4]This game client is written in Flash and can be played in-browser on the official site, on Kongregate, or it can be downloaded from the Google Chrome Web Store. Realm of the Mad God is also available on Steam.[5]Contents  [hide] 1	Gameplay2	Development3	Reception4	References5	External linksGameplay[edit]The game consists of players shooting projectiles from their weapons and destroying enemies to earn experience, fame, and equipment. A character moves around using the WASD keys (though other controls can be chosen) and uses the mouse to aim and clicks to shoot.[6] Contrary to usual practice in MMOs, the experience for killing monsters is awarded in full to each player present, rather than split. This, along with the possibility of teleporting to any player on the map instantly and a cooldown of 10 seconds to teleport again, makes it very easy and attractive to team up.After a certain amount of experience has been earned, the player levels up and their attributes are raised, allowing them to fight more powerful enemies and unlock more classes. The maximum level a player can achieve is level 20. The player can then gain "fame" on their character, which eventually grants permanent stars that indicate accomplishment and may entitle one to a place on the game's leaderboards upon death. Character death is permanent, meaning that the character's items and statistics are lost.Players begin their game sessions in the Nexus, a safe haven which can be teleported to at any time. In the Nexus, players may buy consumables using gold purchased with real-life money or they may trade with another character. Another currency is fame, gained when you die. The player enters realms (i.e. game map instances present on the server). Each of these realms are named after powerful monsters in the game(i.e. Medusa, Djinn, Cyclops, Beholder). The capacity of each realm is 85 people at once, and a full realm cannot be entered until a player in it dies or leaves. However, if many players enter a realm at the same time, it can exceed 85.Players fight a monster in game. HUD elements such as the inventory can be seen on the right-hand side.During gameplay, the player is directed to "quest" monsters indicated by a red marker at the edge of the game window. As they level up in the realm, they are guided from the "Lowlands" areas at the edges of the map, through the "Midlands" and "Highlands" to the more difficult "Godlands" in the center of the map. The Godlands hosts powerful monsters known as the Gods of the Realm. Completing certain quests allows "event" bosses to spawn, which can be killed to obtain higher-tier loot and open portals to the rarest dungeons.Killing high-level monsters can grant the player permanent stat boost potions, which are rare and exist in eight variations that correspond to the major attributes(life, mana, vitality, wisdom, defense, dexterity, attack, and speed). Consuming stat potions allows the player to improve their characters stats after reaching the highest level, which can be done until the attribute is maxed out (indicated by its text turning gold). Upon death, the size of the grave left behind corresponds to the number of stats maxed. Items could previously be retrieved from graves, but this functionality was removed as it led to players luring others to their doom to loot their graves.The 14 classes currently available are Wizard, Priest, Archer, Rogue, Warrior, Knight, Paladin, Assassin, Necromancer, Huntress, Mystic, Trickster, Ninja, and Sorcerer. Players begin with only the Wizard class unlocked and successively unlock the remaining classes as they gain experience with each class.[7] There are 8 main stats, defense, attack, speed, dexterity, vitality, wisdom, mana, and life. Each class has its own weapon, armor and ability specifications, base statistic averages and statistic caps. For example, Warriors, Knights, and Paladins have high defense and are the only ones that can use swords and heavy armor, while the Assassin, Rogue and Trickster have the highest potential movement speed and dexterity (rate of fire) statistics and can only use daggers and hide armor.Items are classified into tiers, with higher tier items having better stats. Tiers range from T0-T12 for weapons, T1-T13 for armors, T0-T6 for rings, and T0-T6 for abilities.[8] Some items are un-tiered, giving them a special classification. These items are typically unique, with examples including limited use items, powerful weapons, armor, rings, abilities, and April Fools' Day accouterments. The best items appear in special bags, known as White bags, Purple bags, Cyan Bags, or Potion Bags. These Bags will only drop for players who have delivered a certain percentage of the monster's damage, and can only be seen and picked up by the player it dropped for. Un-tiered (UT) items are currently "Soulbound" which means it is unable to get picked up by any other player or traded to another player.The game features guilds, each allowing for a maximum of 50 players. A guild costs the founding player 1000 fame to name and create, and has a guild hall which can be accessed by members of the guild. Upon a member's death, guild fame is earned proportionally to the amount of fame that the player earned. Guilds can buy upgrades such as larger guild halls and cosmetic features with the guild fame.[9]Development[edit]The game was originally created by Alex Carobus and Rob Shillingsburg, founders of Wild Shadow Studios, for TIGSource's "Assemblee Competition" in October 2009, which limited the competitors to a very small sample of art resources.[10] The developers described the aim of the game was to "shake things up by breaking as many MMO ‘rules’ as we could"[11] It was noticed and received a good response from players,[12] prompting the developers to work on a full game. The game was finally launched in a beta stage on January 10, 2010.[10]Following the initial launch, Spry Fox joined the development team, helping bring the game to a full release out of beta on June 20, 2011.To help fund the game's development, optional microtransactions were added to the game, drawing a mixed response from players.[13] The developers defended the microtransactions, saying "they seemed like the most convenient, customer-friendly way to pay for the game... those that passionately love the game, can spend as much as they want, helping us to grow the game over time."The game has been

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 17, 2015
												This game is fun..only after you put a couple hundred hours into it after you get bombarded with offers about stuff to buy. This game is definitely something I now think of when I hear "pay to play". It's only fun if you have a perfect character but then that ends up dying and you're basically screwed. But don't worry! You can get another character slot! ...by paying real life money. This game is really unique in the fact of how many classes there are. But there's also the fact that the classes are unbalancedOne person can just be a knight and possibly camp because they're so tanky which could prevent others from getting loot.If you get into this game beware, you'll eventaully end up spending money on one of the various packs that are shoved in your face cause you figure "Why the hell not?" but I'd advise that you absolutely do not spend any money on this game.For one thing, you're eventually going to get bored of this game and soon find out you have no reason to play it anymore, as did I find out after realizing how boring and unfun/unbalanced it is to get a good character, without paying of course, which is why my hours for this game is considerabley lower and or higher than others who reviewed this game.I honestly used to think this game was fun, me and my 2 other friends always used to play it. Then one of my friends eventually got bored of it because his best character died. Me and my friend were still doing fine so we continued. I eventually got 2 great characters that both ended up dying due to the unfairness of this game. I tried to start up again with another character but after a week I couldn't bring myself to do it, which is how I eventually quit the game. My friend still plays and I honestly don't get how he does. This game is also heavily relied on luck through what items you get. You may have noticed how I've been complaining about character deaths and there's one word to explain why: permadeath.This game, has permadeath, once you die, no matter how good your character is, no matter how good his equipment is, no matter how many much you claim you pressed the nexus button, you will start all the way from the beginning with a level one character with basic default equipment, what makes the permadeath unfair is that even the items you pay ACTUAL MONEY FOR, you still lose when your character dies. Which is why I advise you to not spend any actual money on this game because you will eventually die and lose the items you paid for which essentially means you lost and wasted money.Another thing that makes this game unbalanced and even more P2W is the pets.Like others have stated there's a pet system in this game that can do various things (heal you, attack, etc)But to make your pets good, you have to feed themAnd you do that by using food, either high tier items (hard to get) or by paying money just to satisfy some pixels on a screen.Here's some pros and cons to sum up those couple paragraphs;Pro's:Fun (by yourself or with friends)Unique class systemGood guild systemRewarding when you actually get lootCons:EXTREMELY pay to playPermadeath not executed that greatlyUnbalanced to a great degreePet system reliant on payingEssentially a time wasterI find it very hard to recommend this game to anyone who is looking for a free game on steam that is very heavily pay to play. If you do decide to play this game I heavily advise you  to not spend any money on it because you will eventually get bored of it and the money you spent will be gone into the toilet. This game used to be more fun before Kabam made as pay to play as it is today.

content:
Posted: March 14, 2015
												Realm Of The Mad god Is A Pretty fun game! But it has its drawbacks. Living/playing this game feels like we have a hated dictator that EVERYONE hates. Kabam. Although I do not play on steam i have around 2000 hours on the Chrome browser ( www.RealmOftheMadGod.com) and i have seen the changes that kabam has made. First they implemented pets, Seemed like a good idea, UNTILL IT GIVES YOU 100 HP EVERY 5 SEC (Extremely OverPowered, you never die) Witch is cool! if you earn it. But Kabam has made this game Pay-To-Win. So there can be a 5 yearold who Grabs his moms credit card and just Buys boatloads of items and buys an OP pet and whaddya know? Hes Equal to Henez Or Kalle or Any of those skilled players (Charactar and item wise ples dont H8 , btw henez and kalle ROTMG legends). This is aggrovating to see. Overall i think this game is amazing, simply incredible, how much it is skill and luck based, the grinding, the glory of getting a item you have been hunting for, the " NOOO, THIS CANNOT BE!" of Oryx 1 and Oryx 2 dying, is Amazing. I Have to say its even kinda fun when your charactar dies ( Unless its unfair, such as server lagg, R.I.P 6/8 knight) so overall this game is amazing, and it has the potential and the community (Shout out to all them guys on youtube twitch kabam fourms and even the players.) But the fact that a company is driving this game into the ground to get EXCESS money is Ridiculous. Hopefully another company will buy this game, And then , I will feel happy to come back home.

content:
Posted: September 3, 2014
												All you Kabam haters: I feel you, I've been playing this since some of the early public builds and I've seen a fare share of stupidity on the part of Devs. Build 7-9 was the last time I played Co-op Dungeons (they took stat pots out of God Lands) and learning to solo dungeons with any character was a game changer for me personally.Play to Win? No, all the cash you spend isn't gonna get you any better at the game despite all the loot you purchase, we've all seen newbs die horribly with tops. A Stock newb with purchased tops won't hold a candle to a maxed character with mid-tier gear, and they don't officially sell stat pots/UT items in game so that swag is up to the player, not the wallet.After Lvl 20 with any character your top priority is Stat pot acquisition. Yes it can be a grind, and perma death is real, but this game would be junk without perma death. My advice: Lay down the 10-20 bucks on a extra character slot and some storage chests. You will Die lots, you will crap Keyboards sideways, and you will quit, perhaps even forever. But you could also kick♥♥♥♥♥Pets made this game so easy anyway that I will agree with some people: It was a better realm under WildShadow, but I still recommend it to anyone wanting to flex their skills and strut their gear.

content:
Posted: July 10, 2015
												Great game! 400+ Hours of gametime for me... i would rate 7/10.Kabam bought this game from Wildshadow Studios, then Kabam took developers off the game leaving currently 2 developers working on this game... Ive written the review on July 10, 2015. Using that time im not expecting any updates for the next 6 months, but honestly if Kabam doesnt pick up their brain off the floor there will not be a Realm of the Mad God anymore. In my opinion we have to buy more "realm gold" so they can realize Realm of the Mad God actualy makes them money, this will also support the current developers. I love this game and i would hate to see it fall, it has a great community and amazing gameplay! I would recommend this game to anyone who is into "CS:GO" or just likes skill based games(this game takes skill). It is pay to win in a sense, but you can obtain almost any item in the game by playing it.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 25, 2016
												I used to play the Realm of the Mad God online before it was cool, jk, before I had a Steam account, and I still love playing it with friends. It is a very addictive 8-bit fast action RPG which I play from time to time.Here comes the piece of advice about the gameplay: don't get too attached to your characters, you are gonna die, a lot. Even if you have managed to reach the max level with a class and have your inventory full of overpowered items, you'll eventually die and lose everything. Save high level items that your class can't use in your chest so when you die, because you'll die, you can try a new class with high level items from the beginning.Moral of the game: spam the shot click, get cutty pets, do random♥♥♥♥♥♥with random players along the map, defeat Oryx and overall don't get this game too serious, play it when you are stressed and want to unwind yourself.

content:
Posted: November 13, 2015
												~Bold Starr~'s Realm of the Mad God ReviewPros:+Dungeon crawler.+Roguelike MMO.+A whole 14 Classes.+Tons of weapons, abilities, armour, etc.+100+ hours of gameplay worthy. (Depends if you like dungeon crawlers)+Simple and easy to get used to.+Tons of fun with friends.Cons:-Perma death. (You'll loose your character and all of it's items upon death)-Definantly repetitive. (This could be a pro or con)-Tons of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s and jerks.-Modding / Hacking players galore!-Updates are practically a myth.-It's hard to continue at a point of the game without putting money into it.Even if this game sounds cancerous due to the cons, this game is very well layed out, I play it almost everyday, not on steam, but flash player. I reccomend you were to at LEAST try the game out.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 14, 2015
												I dumped at least 2k hours into this game on the browser version. I played for about 3 years before quitting out of boredom. This game is great, and very well made... but VERY poorly managed. Anyone that has been playing this game for at least 2 1/2 years will tell you all about how they hate Kabam for screwing up everything. This is true, however the game is not bad because of the mismanagement of Kabam. Kabam bought this game from Wild Shadow Studios, who were the original makers of the game, and started taking the game in a direction that the community was not too fond of. Before that, the game was very fun and spectacularly addicting... and it still is. The point is... don't get caught up in all the people telling you this game is terrible because of the mismanagement. If you like roguelike MMORPGs, this is one of the best, and easily my favorite.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 5
												After 200+ hours on steam and countless on the web i have come to the conclusion that this game is wholly not worth it.One main thing that has finally sent me over the edge on this opinon of my personal fav dungeon crawler is that THIS GAME HAS ZERO SUPPORT, now one may say had they been playing for a while "Stan! Stan! come now deca answer Support tickets reguarding bannings very quickly" And while these people would be right about that, Deca (The current dev team) seem to be absent when it comes to game lag, input lag, loot and economy balancing and unjust player death, to name a few. To elaborate on the lag this game faces on both ends Stems mostly from the game being coded in flash thus limmiting the game heavily. On the front of economy,loot... the sale of end game items only effects the economy (GOOD ITEMS DOES NOT A GOOD PLAYER MAKE) Driving prices down, but who cares! as the most glaring problems apper in this game when you realise That this game has no progression in the end game and no reason to be better. IE in a game like chess you play to be better at the game than other players, or like quake as you get better at the game you are clearly better than new players and you have the skill to show for it. Now realm of the mad cuck does have skill as better players can dodge duck and dive like the best of em but that doesn't matter in a game like realm as the loot is random meaning no matter how good you are you will never be rewarded for your skill save for being spared for the crule hand of death, Oh wait going back to the lag this game faces Skill will not save you from the lag no matter how hard you try in this game the lag will get you at some point. This brings us to the crux of my little rant here Skill does nothing in this game and means nothing therefore the question is begged!WHY THE ♥♥♥♥ WOULD YOU WANT TO PLAY A GAME WHERE YOU ARE NOT REWARDED FOR SKILL, PUNISHED FOR THINGS OUT OF YOUR CONTROLL AND THEN NOT EVEN GIVEN AN ANWSER AS TO WHY?(Although i can not find the total ernings of realm (mostly from lack of trying) i can say that there are currently positions ranging 20k-80k per year, they have to money to remake realm and then some. And while they're at it put in a better guild/party system and make class varitey an actual thing please)
